title: A small town arts scene in Vermont is among the best in America, according USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Stowe, Vermont, ranked No. 9 in USA Today's 2026 10Best Readersâ€™ Choice Awards for small town arts scenes.
Stowe's arts scene features galleries, Spruce Peak Arts performances, and the annual Stowe Foliage Arts Festival.
Vermillion, South Dakota, topped the list with its National Music Museum, galleries, and public art displays.

title: Not in Boston? Your space saver is likely illegal
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Most Massachusetts cities and towns outside Boston ban space savers, with fines up to $100 for violations.
Boston allows space savers during snow emergencies, but bans them in Bay Village and the South End.
Cambridge and Somerville actively remove unauthorized space savers and urge residents to be considerate when parking.

title: ESPN insider has Roman Anthony ranked among MLB’s top-10 corner outfielders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Roman Anthony of the Boston Red Sox ranks No. 7 among MLB corner outfielders in Buster Olney's list.
Anthony posted a .292/.386/.463 slash line and eight home runs in 71 games during his rookie season.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora plans to keep Anthony as leadoff, citing his .396 on-base percentage.

title: Where do you get a meal for under $20 in Malden?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston.com invites readers to submit recommendations for meals under $20 in Malden.
The initiative is part of a project to find budget-friendly dining options in Boston suburbs.
Readers can contribute by emailing or filling a form, with responses possibly featured in a guide.

title: The story behind this viral photo of an unplowed Fall River street
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Fall River streets, including June Street, remain unplowed days after a major blizzard hit the area.
City officials, hampered by limited snow removal equipment, are focusing on clearing numerous unplowed streets.
Residents express frustration over the slow plowing response and its impact on daily life and work obligations.

title: The ultra-rare Honus Wagner card with local ties just sold for a world-record-breaking amount
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A 1909 T206 Honus Wagner baseball card sold for a record $5.12 million at Goldin auction house.
The card, owned by the Shields family from Taunton, Massachusetts, was in the family for 117 years.
The sale set an all-time record for PSA 1 grade cards, surpassing the previous $3.1 million record by 64 percent.

title: ICE deportees reportedly held on N.H. tarmac for more than 12 hours during storm
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: A flight with about 100 ICE detainees was grounded at Portsmouth International Airport for over 30 hours due to a storm.
Detainees spent about 13 hours on the plane before being allowed into a terminal for food, water, and restrooms.
The flight, delayed by a blizzard, eventually departed Portsmouth and landed in Sofia, Bulgaria, before heading to Doha, Qatar.

title: Reggie Miller: Celtics are ‘scariest’ team in the East with or without Jayson Tatum
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Boston Celtics have won nine of their last 10 games, maintaining second place in the Eastern Conference.
Reggie Miller considers the Celtics the 'scariest' team in the East, with or without star Jayson Tatum.
Jaylen Brown is a key player, averaging 29.2 points, 7 rebounds, and 4.7 assists, contributing to Boston's strong defense.

title: $7 million Chatham house has a private sandy beach: ‘Super desirable and rare’
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: A historic Cape-style home at 150 Main Street, Chatham, is listed for $6.95 million with a private beach.
The property features 2,552 square feet, seven bedrooms, 2.5 baths, and 75 feet of beach frontage.
Due to its location in the Village Historic District, the house requires preservation rather than demolition.

title: A social media post about a traveler’s ‘masterclass in boundaries’ on a flight out of Maine goes viral
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: A viral social media post highlights a woman's firm response to personal space invasion on a flight from Maine.
User @digbymomma's post about the incident garnered 31,000 likes, over 500 comments, and nearly 100 shares.
Commenters praised the woman's assertiveness and shared personal stories of similar boundary issues during travel.
